question: Build the soccer fields as designed by Amesbury Soccer Association, next repave Riverwalk

Lake Gardner is a mess but could be so lovely
Limit Lake Gardner to residence only, improve the beach and enforce litter laws in that whole area. Lake Garner could be a gem but it has turned into a seedy undesirable place in the summer.
Playground downtown near amphitheater
Off leash option at Woodsom similar to what nbpt does at Moseley/marches hill/cashman
the low lands on Woodsom farm are reverting back to forest, they need to be mowed.  If the streams that run through Woodsom were cleaned out so water could run, there would be less mosquitoes.
Off leash dog walking
Manage invasive plants, increase signage - marking trails, informative kiosks, better trail maintenance to prevent erosion and avoid wetlands (e.g., boardwalks), manage for healthy wildlife habitat.
Leave Woodsom Farm alone. I understand there need to be a new school but it does not belong there. Figure something else out. A great deal of money will have been wasted for nothing come this fall.
designated Off leash dog park, sidewalks on both side of streets to walk to the location, connecting the open spaces
Maintaining the over growth of vegetation growth along  the outskirts of "the Pines" in the town park/curating trees to replace those that fall.
Better maintaining what we have
A public swimming pool
Keep dogs on a leash.
I would like a natatorium

Cleaners, newer would  be nice. Dog park would be great
Trail days to encourage community involvement with trail maintenance.
Do not get rid of  or build on any open space.  Keep it for recreation and its beauty.

To make a better, all-season trail connection between Woodsom and Town Forest; to preserve all existing town public green spaces against new construction; to clean up the abandoned structures at Camp Kent
Fix the Basketball Hoop near Collins St playground, consider re-paving riverwalk bike trail (some roots have compromised some of the trail)
The addition of recycle barrels and improved sidewalks
Improve lower millyard. Currently a wasted space in an otherwise bustling downtown.
Long term planning and maintenance
Stop cutting down the forest to build condos, i.e. Kimball Road, The Heights

Keep them undeveloped

Paving the roads to get there!

To keep them clean, well-maintained and accessible to people especially residents of Amesbury.

Cashman playground at Cashman Elementary should be focused on right away!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!(the playground to the right of the school).
Put a turf field in laundry stadium and let soccer, field hockey and other sports use it just like Newburyport does with its stadium.

Lake Gardner beach- reopen bathrooms (no one leaves the water for a dirty port a potty), staff the gate, trash, no smoking or swearing enforced, improve the infrastructure there and monitor so that it is not being abused. This place could be a jewel!
Trails at Battis farm should be wider
We need more athletic fields to accommodate the needs of all organized teams. And all current fields need some much needed maintenance.
Easier access to kayaks for Lake Attitash and Lake Gardner. Widened/improved sidewalks from Woodsom Farm into town. Secure bike racks downtown (please!).

Just maintain what we have. Do text it get in such disrepair that there is a need to build “brand new” facilities. Pay attention to maintenance so that our community can enjoy life and the community can thrive
Fenced in off-leash dog park or area - would solve many problems and be nice for the pups!
None
A recreational center
Dog park
Keep them open with no development

Kids, pre teens, teens a young adults need something to do. Open space is NOT something that's for them.More parks, Bigger parks, more park equipment. Look at Griffin park in Windham. It;s a massive outdoor space with soccer, baseball, lacrosse, skate park, basketball, tennis, figure 8 walking loop, bathroom, concession stand and a playground. It's a one stop shop for all types of families, old and young. It's a place for the ENTIRE community to congregate, meet up have play dates.
Keep all fields and open spaces intact and strive to create more open green spaces.
Town needs a youth/recreation center
Lake Gardner grounds /beach
Keep Woodsom as open space. Do not move baseball fields there or enhance the existing soccer fields
Make Woodsom Farm and Battis off leash dog parks on opposite days
toilet facilities
Preserve existing spaces
Would love a small playground in the upper mill yard - outside flatbread, possibly behind Amesbury industrial. Also, remove the water fountain in the open space near flatbread.
Expand, and maintain! Some of the best athletes around and the WORST playing fields in the area.
Maintain lake Gardner beach. Playground in amphitheater area
Perfect!

Try harder to enforce leash laws
clean bathrooms at lake Gardner

mow the sides of the side roads that are overgrown currently.
It would be great to see some sort of playground in the upper or lower millyard. It would encourage people to spend more time downtown with kids.

Protect the open spaces against further encroachment. The AES site selection process was a disappointing process and demonstrated how some elected officials rationalize making exceptions to the will of their constituents. I personally am happy to turn open space control over to 3rd parties, as they seem more true to preservation than the tax-rate focused administration.

Make sure there is REGULAR maintenance whether it's weed control, trash collection, repair of walkways or equipment at all sites. Merrill St. Amesbury Trailhead needs serious weeding. Repaving the road would improve access.

Improvements to the linkage / signage on the trail systems of Battis / Pow wow hill area. Especially the AES trail section. Section of trail is poorly defined and makes if seem like your walking though the back yards of the condo / town houses.  Additionally. Explore making final connections / linkages even if needed to be 'on road' (or sidewalk) between existing open spaces.  Example:  Town Beach and the extended Battis / Pow wow hill area with Whitterhill / Woodsom / Town Forest.  This would extend and link the areas and be a bonus for residents and visitors.
Not to put a road in or new athletic fields at Woodsom (fixing the soccer fields makes sense).

Take better care of the pines.  it's starting to be overgrown with deciduous trees. There is zero maintenance on the hill,  The sidewalk will soon be blocked by unintentional overgrowth

 Provide public access to lake Attitash or stop providing funds to improve the lake 

Improve lake Gardner. 

Improved trail signage in town forest
Dog park
Please fix the lake Gardner beach, it's such an amazing asset to our town, I'm so sad to see the condition it's in.
grass needs to be kept shorter on the soccer fields

You will hear otherwise from other families, but I do not want playing fields to be artificial turf. Natural grass provides important ecological functions in addition to being appropriate for youth sports. Please priorities areas where the community should put deed restrictions on open space (so places that should stay protected and have little or passive recreational use vs. places appropriate for ball fields or other municipal needs). I have a dog and love being able to walk my dog on town land. Having designated off leash area that is large enough to take a walk would be great (like Mosley woods in Newburyport).
Fenced dog park
